repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.unittitle: John R. Commons Collection on Microfilm
did.abstract: "The Commons papers date 1859-1967, although the vast majority fall within the years 1887-1945" from the Scope and Content Note of the Guide.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: John R. Commons was born in Hollansburg, Ohio, October 13, 1862, he died May 11, 1945.

After graduating from Oberlin College, Commons earned his PhD at Johns Hopkins University. After appointments at Oberlin and Indiana University, he began teaching at Syracuse University. He was dismissed from Syracuse in 1899, after being considered a radical.
Commons' early work exemplified his desire to unite Christian ideals with the emerging social sciences of sociology and economics.
Common's contribution to labor history is considered equal to his contibutions to the theory of institutional economics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reels 6-8 -- Unemployment insurance for the Chicago Clothing Market, 1922-1929
Reels 15-17 -- Articles, speeches, and miscellaneous writings, chronological file, scrapbooks, 1887-1918, 1938-1943
Reels 19-21 -- Topical file, 1892-1938. Reels 21-22 -- Newspaper clippings, 1906-1936

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: John R. Commons Collection on Microfilm #5738 mf. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
